weeklyTopNews.title: At-risk tenants of Victoria's public housing towers to be offered private rentals
weeklyTopNews.summary: The Victorian government is launching a new $31.7 million initiative to provide at-risk public housing tenants with leases to private rental properties.

weeklyTopNews.title: Daniel Andrews says lockdown 'is working', as Victoria's daily coronavirus infections drop below 100
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victoria's daily coronavirus numbers dropped below 100 for the first time in 2 months. The state reported only 95 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest number since July 5th. There were also 18 more deaths overnight, taking the state's toll to 513, and the country's to 600.

weeklyTopNews.title: Coronavirus outbreak at Frankston Hospital in Melbourne's south-east sends more than 600 staff into quarantine
weeklyTopNews.summary: A coronavirus outbreak at Frankston Hospital has lead to 618 staff being furloughed according to Peninsula Health. There are currently 44 active cases among Peninsula Health staff.

weeklyTopNews.title: Victoria's coronavirus case numbers keep falling, as Daniel Andrews flags state of emergency extension
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victoria's case numbers dropped sharply with only 116 announced today. This is the lowest daily tally since July 5th, when 74 cases were announced. July 5th was also the last time the number of new cases announced was under a hundred. Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews also announced today that the government is looking at extending the the state of emergency provisions that allowed for the coronavirus restrictions for 12 more months.
